TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DiscreteThicknessKeyFrame extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessKeyFrame

Docs.summary: Animates from the value of the previous key frame to its own using discrete interpolation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessKeyFrameCollection> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessAnimationUsingKeyFrames> to animate a <xref:System.Windows.Thickness> property value along a set of key frames.
A key frame defines a segment of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessAnimationUsingKeyFrames> to which it belongs. Each key frame has a target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessKeyFrame.Value%2A> and a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessKeyFrame.KeyTime%2A>. The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessKeyFrame.KeyTime%2A> specifies the time at which the key frame's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessKeyFrame.Value%2A> should be reached. A key frame animates from the target value of the previous key frame to its own target value. It starts when the previous key frame ends and ends when its own key time is reached.
Discrete key frames like <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DiscreteThicknessKeyFrame> create sudden "jumps" between values (no interpolation). In other words, the animated property does not change until the key frame's key time is reached, at which point the animated property goes suddenly to the target value.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Windows.Thickness value, valuetype System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime keyTime) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The ending value (also known as "target value") for the key frame.
The key time for the key frame. The key time determines when the target value is reached, which is also when the key frame ends.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified ending value and key time.

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Thickness InterpolateValueCore(valuetype System.Windows.Thickness baseValue, float64 keyFrameProgress) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function InterpolateValueCore (baseValue As Thickness, keyFrameProgress As Double) As Thickness
protected: override System::Windows::Thickness InterpolateValueCore(System::Windows::Thickness baseValue, double keyFrameProgress);

Docs.param: A value from 0.0 through 1.0 that specifies the percentage of time that has elapsed for this key frame.
Docs.summary: Interpolates, between the previous key frame value and the value of the current key frame using discrete interpolation.
Docs.returns: The output value of this key frame given the specified base value and progress.
